annoyed  Your television stops working. Your favorite show was on tonight!

amused  You watch a segment about dog hairstyling. Apparently square heads are in!
amused  Your grandchild tells you he has girl problems and asks why girls are so complicated.
ashamed: ashamed  You forget to send your son a birthday gift.
ashamed  You realize you haven’t cleaned the house in two months.
ashamed  You open the supply closet and a mountain of useless objects come tumbling down.
attraction: attraction  Your significant other wrote you a heart-warming card.
attraction  You notice your significant other wearing the socks you gave them at the beginning of the relationship.
attraction  You receive a box of your favorite pastries with a note saying, I love you.
betrayed: betrayed  Your friend tells you they’re meeting Taylor later today. But Taylor told you she was out of town!
betrayed  Your significant other tells you their feeling too tired for date night tonight. But they promised!
betrayed  Your granddaughter tells you she’s going to name her daughter after her husband’s mother instead of yours.
bitter: bitter  You buy an expensive bouquet of flowers only to be told by your significant other that they hate lilies.
bitter  You lent your friend, Alex, twenty dollars. Alex says that never happened.
bitter  You read an article about seniors. Apparently seniors contribute nothing to society!
bored: bored  You finish watching your movie and wonder what to do next.
bored  You want to bake, but don’t have the majority of the ingredients. What to do instead?
bored  You sit in your chair and watch the sky.
calm: calm You paint a sunset on the canvas and admire the colors.
calm You lie on the bed with your dog, Jack, snuggled in your armpit.
calm You sit on the sofa to read your newest book.
cheerful: cheerful You open the window to hear the birds sing and smell the flowers.
cheerful You let the sun’s rays warm your face and think, The world is beautiful!
cheerful You eat a bowl of cheerios and laugh at your old photos.
cocky: cocky You look in the mirror and admire your full head of hair.
cocky You boast to your friend that your granchildren got into an ivy league.
cocky You come in st in the marathon for seniors.
courageous: courageous You decide to perm your hair.
courageous You decide to tackle the toughest recipe in the book for the family gathering.
depressed: depressed You look at your hands and wonder when you’ll die.
depressed You text your grandchildren and they use a new teenage slang that you don't understand.
depressed You decide you don’t want to go shopping after all because you think you’re too old to dress fashionably.
determined: determined You are determined to organize your photos today. It will get done!
determined You decide to start watching the news from now on.
determined You decide you’re going to start exercising again. Now to find my sneakers!
disgust: disgust You find that the banana you left out a week ago is shriveled and covered in fruit flies.
disgust You drag a finger across the bookshelf and find your finger covered in black dust.
disgust You see people walking in the streets staring at their phones.
embarrassed: embarrassed Your grandchild asks you what 9 times 8 is, but you forgot years ago.
embarrassed You tell your son you don’t remember what your phone number is.
embarrassed Your daughter tells you she accidentally bought squash instead of cucumbers.
frustrated: frustrated You can barely touch your feet anymore.
frustrated You know you left your keys somewhere in your home, but can’t remember where.
frustrated Your shoe laces keep getting untied.
hopeful: hopeful You buy a lottery ticket because it feels like a good day.
hopeful You find your mother’s old earrings and wonder if the matching necklace is somewhere as well.
hopeful You wonder who your next grandchild will look like.
horrified: horrified You spend all afternoon finishing your 400 piece puzzle. When you go to the kitchen, you see that your dog has destroyed the puzzle and is now gnawing on a piece.
horrified You’ve been walking around with a large brown stain on the bottom of your pants. So that’s where the bar of chocolate went!
horrified You drop your wallet into the crack as the elevator door opens.
humiliated: humiliated You realize you’ve been walking around with your fly unzipped.
humiliated You just peed yourself in public.
humiliated You realize you forgot how to do long division when you look at your grandson’s homework.
lucky: lucky A marathon of your favorite show is on! Grab some popcorn!
lucky You find a twenty dollar bill stuck in the laundry basket.
lucky You are having a great hair day!
insecurity: insecurity You look at your hair and wonder if it’s time for a change.
insecurity You wonder if you should get your gray hairs dyed black.
insecurity You wonder if you should skip the cheese on your pasta today.
inspired: inspired You find your old drawing tools and decide to start drawing again.
inspired The sky looks beautiful today. You take a photograph to keep it as inspiration.
inspired You find your collection of stamps and decide to continue again.
lazy: lazy  You regret eating the extra slice of apple pie. You’re too full to move.
pessimistic: pessimistic You decide learning to play sudoku will be a waste of time.
pessimistic You go through a carton of ice cream and wonder if you’ve done anything with your life.
pessimistic You wonder why anyone works hard in life when we’re all going to die anyway.
hungry: hungry You open the freezer to get a scoop of that new flavor of Ben & Jerry’s you bought last weekend.
hungry You open the drawer and take out the pile of takeout menus. Now what to order?
hungry You make a pb&j sandwich almost 5cm high.
